Key Match Events: Gleyber Torres led off with a double, and Juan Soto kept his hot streak going with a single into right, followed by Aaron Judge hitting a sacrifice fly to score the Yankees’ third run of the contest
Tanner Bibee was chased from the game after just 1 1/3 innings, allowing two earned runs on five hits and a walk while recording two strikeouts
Brayan Rocchio was able to get Rizzo out at third base, shutting down what could have been a major scoring opportunity for New York
José Ramírez blasted a solo shot in the 9th
Post-Match Reflections: If the Guardians want to claw their way back from a 2-0 hole, they’ll need to play smart, aggressive baseball — specifically, by exposing any cracks in the Yankees’ bullpen and improving their situational hitting with runners in scoring position
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees got to Guardians ace Tanner Bibee early in the game
The Guardians showed persistence and smart at-bats, demonstrating their ability to manufacture runs without relying on the long ball
The Yankees’ three biggest hitters have homered in the first two games of the series
